channel.title: NHC Atlantic
channel.description: Active tropical cyclones in the Atlantic, Caribbean, and the Gulf of Mexico

item.title: Atlantic Tropical Weather Outlook
item.description:
000
ABNT20 KNHC 142317
TWOAT

TROPICAL WEATHER OUTLOOK
NWS NATIONAL HURRICANE CENTER MIAMI FL
800 PM EDT TUE JUL 14 2015

For the North Atlantic...Caribbean Sea and the Gulf of Mexico:

The National Hurricane Center is issuing advisories on Tropical
Storm Claudette, located a couple of hundred miles southeast of
Halifax, Nova Scotia.

Tropical cyclone formation is not expected during the next 5 days.

$$
Forecaster Pasch
item.author: nhcwebmaster@noaa.gov (NHC Webmaster)

item.title: Summary for Post-Tropical Cyclone CLAUDETTE (AT3/AL032015)
item.author: nhcwebmaster@noaa.gov (NHC Webmaster)
item.description: ...CLAUDETTE NOW A POST-TROPICAL CYCLONE... ...THIS IS THE LAST ADVISORY... As of 11:00 PM AST Tue Jul 14 the center of CLAUDETTE was located near 43.8, -57.8 with movement NE at 21 mph. The minimum central pressure was 1004 mb with maximum sustained winds of about 45 mph.

nhc:Cyclone.nhc:name: CLAUDETTE
nhc:Cyclone.nhc:headline: ...CLAUDETTE NOW A POST-TROPICAL CYCLONE... ...THIS IS THE LAST ADVISORY...

item.title: Post-Tropical Cyclone CLAUDETTE Public Advisory Number 7
item.description:
Issued at 1100 PM AST TUE JUL 14 2015 

000
WTNT33 KNHC 150232
TCPAT3

BULLETIN
POST-TROPICAL CYCLONE CLAUDETTE ADVISORY NUMBER   7
NWS NATIONAL HURRICANE CENTER MIAMI FL       AL032015
1100 PM AST TUE JUL 14 2015

...CLAUDETTE NOW A POST-TROPICAL CYCLONE...
...THIS IS THE LAST ADVISORY...


SUMMARY OF 1100 PM AST...0300 UTC...INFORMATION
-----------------------------------------------
LOCATION...43.8N 57.8W
ABOUT 290 MI...470 KM E OF HALIFAX NOVA SCOTIA
MAXIMUM SUSTAINED WINDS...45 MPH...75 KM/H
PRESENT MOVEMENT...NE OR 45 DEGREES AT 21 MPH...33 KM/H
MINIMUM CENTRAL PRESSURE...1004 MB...29.65 INCHES


WATCHES AND WARNINGS
--------------------
There are no coastal watches or warnings in effect.


DISCUSSION AND 48-HOUR OUTLOOK
------------------------------
At 1100 PM AST (0300 UTC), the center of Post-Tropical Cyclone
Claudette was located near latitude 43.8 North, longitude 57.8 West.
The post-tropical cyclone is moving toward the northeast near 21 mph
(33 km/h), and this motion is expected to continue through tomorrow.

Maximum sustained winds are near 45 mph (75 km/h) with higher gusts.
Weakening is expected overnight, with dissipation forecast to
occur on Wednesday.

Tropical storm force winds extend outward up to 80 miles (130 km)
from the center.

The estimated minimum central pressure is 1004 mb (29.65 inches).


HAZARDS AFFECTING LAND
----------------------
None


NEXT ADVISORY
-------------
This is the last public advisory issued by the National Hurricane
Center on Claudette.  Additional information on this system can be
found in High Seas Forecasts issued by the National Weather Service,
under AWIPS header NFDHSFAT1, WMO header FZNT01 KWBC, and available
on the Web at http://www.opc.ncep.noaa.gov/shtml/NFDHSFAT1.shtml.

$$
Forecaster Cangialosi
item.author: nhcwebmaster@noaa.gov (NHC Webmaster)

item.title: Post-Tropical Cyclone CLAUDETTE Forecast Advisory Number 7
item.description:
Issued at 0300 UTC WED JUL 15 2015 

000
WTNT23 KNHC 150232
TCMAT3

POST-TROPICAL CYCLONE CLAUDETTE FORECAST/ADVISORY NUMBER   7
NWS NATIONAL HURRICANE CENTER MIAMI FL       AL032015
0300 UTC WED JUL 15 2015

THERE ARE NO COASTAL WATCHES OR WARNINGS IN EFFECT.

POST-TROPICAL CYCLONE CENTER LOCATED NEAR 43.8N  57.8W AT 15/0300Z
POSITION ACCURATE WITHIN  50 NM

PRESENT MOVEMENT TOWARD THE NORTHEAST OR  45 DEGREES AT  18 KT

ESTIMATED MINIMUM CENTRAL PRESSURE 1004 MB
MAX SUSTAINED WINDS  40 KT WITH GUSTS TO  50 KT.
34 KT....... 60NE  70SE  60SW   0NW.
12 FT SEAS.. 60NE 130SE  90SW   0NW.
WINDS AND SEAS VARY GREATLY IN EACH QUADRANT.  RADII IN NAUTICAL
MILES ARE THE LARGEST RADII EXPECTED ANYWHERE IN THAT QUADRANT.

REPEAT...CENTER LOCATED NEAR 43.8N  57.8W AT 15/0300Z
AT 15/0000Z CENTER WAS LOCATED NEAR 43.1N  58.5W

FORECAST VALID 15/1200Z 46.0N  55.5W...POST-TROP/EXTRATROP
MAX WIND  35 KT...GUSTS  45 KT.
34 KT...100NE 120SE  60SW   0NW.

FORECAST VALID 16/0000Z...DISSIPATED

REQUEST FOR 3 HOURLY SHIP REPORTS WITHIN 300 MILES OF 43.8N  57.8W

THIS IS THE LAST FORECAST/ADVISORY ISSUED BY THE NATIONAL HURRICANE
CENTER ON CLAUDETTE.  ADDITIONAL INFORMATION ON THE POST-TROPICAL
SYSTEM CAN BE FOUND IN HIGH SEAS FORECASTS ISSUED BY THE NATIONAL
WEATHER SERVICE...UNDER AWIPS HEADER NFDHSFAT1 AND WMO HEADER
FZNT01 KWBC.

$$
FORECASTER CANGIALOSI
item.author: nhcwebmaster@noaa.gov (NHC Webmaster)

item.title: Post-Tropical Cyclone CLAUDETTE Forecast Discussion Number 7
item.description:
Issued at 1100 PM AST TUE JUL 14 2015 

000
WTNT43 KNHC 150233
TCDAT3

POST-TROPICAL CYCLONE CLAUDETTE DISCUSSION NUMBER   7
NWS NATIONAL HURRICANE CENTER MIAMI FL       AL032015
1100 PM AST TUE JUL 14 2015

Claudette has lacked organized deep convection for nearly 10 hours
now, and it only consists of a swirl of low-level clouds.  The
cyclone is currently over SSTs near 17 C, so it is highly unlikely
that significant thunderstorm activity will return.  Therefore,
Claudette is considered a post-tropical cyclone, and this is the
last advisory on this system issued by the National Hurricane
Center.

The post-tropical cyclone is moving quickly northeastward at
about 18 kt, and this general motion is expected to continue until
the cyclone dissipates on Wednesday.  The current wind speed is
estimated to be 40 kt based on recent ASCAT data.  Environment
Canada's buoy 44141 has been helpful in locating the center and
estimating the minimum pressure.

Additional information on this system can be found in High Seas
Forecasts issued by the National Weather Service, under AWIPS
header NFDHSFAT1, WMO header FZNT01 KWBC, and available on the Web
at http://www.opc.ncep.noaa.gov/shtml/NFDHSFAT1.shtml.

FORECAST POSITIONS AND MAX WINDS

INIT  15/0300Z 43.8N  57.8W   40 KT  45 MPH...POST-TROPICAL
 12H  15/1200Z 46.0N  55.5W   35 KT  40 MPH...POST-TROP/EXTRATROP
 24H  16/0000Z...DISSIPATED

$$
Forecaster Cangialosi
item.author: nhcwebmaster@noaa.gov (NHC Webmaster)

item.title: Post-Tropical Cyclone CLAUDETTE Wind Speed Probabilities Number 7
item.description:
Issued at 0300 UTC WED JUL 15 2015 

000
FONT13 KNHC 150232
PWSAT3
                                                                    
POST-TROPICAL CYCLONE CLAUDETTE WIND SPEED PROBABILITIES NUMBER   7 
NWS NATIONAL HURRICANE CENTER MIAMI FL       AL032015               
0300 UTC WED JUL 15 2015                                            
                                                                    
AT 0300Z THE CENTER OF POST-TROPICAL CYCLONE CLAUDETTE WAS LOCATED  
NEAR LATITUDE 43.8 NORTH...LONGITUDE 57.8 WEST WITH MAXIMUM         
SUSTAINED WINDS NEAR 40 KTS...45 MPH...75 KM/H.                     
                                                                    
Z INDICATES COORDINATED UNIVERSAL TIME (GREENWICH)                  
   ATLANTIC STANDARD TIME (AST)...SUBTRACT 4 HOURS FROM Z TIME      
   EASTERN  DAYLIGHT TIME (EDT)...SUBTRACT 4 HOURS FROM Z TIME      
   CENTRAL  DAYLIGHT TIME (CDT)...SUBTRACT 5 HOURS FROM Z TIME      
                                                                    
WIND SPEED PROBABILITY TABLE FOR SPECIFIC LOCATIONS                 
                                                                    
CHANCES OF SUSTAINED (1-MINUTE AVERAGE) WIND SPEEDS OF AT LEAST     
   ...34 KT (39 MPH... 63 KM/H)...                                  
   ...50 KT (58 MPH... 93 KM/H)...                                  
   ...64 KT (74 MPH...119 KM/H)...                                  
FOR LOCATIONS AND TIME PERIODS DURING THE NEXT 5 DAYS               
                                                                    
PROBABILITIES FOR LOCATIONS ARE GIVEN AS OP(CP) WHERE               
    OP  IS THE PROBABILITY OF THE EVENT BEGINNING DURING            
        AN INDIVIDUAL TIME PERIOD (ONSET PROBABILITY)               
   (CP) IS THE PROBABILITY OF THE EVENT OCCURRING BETWEEN           
        00Z WED AND THE FORECAST HOUR (CUMULATIVE PROBABILITY)      
                                                                    
PROBABILITIES ARE GIVEN IN PERCENT                                  
X INDICATES PROBABILITIES LESS THAN 1 PERCENT                       
PROBABILITIES FOR 34 KT AND 50 KT ARE SHOWN AT A GIVEN LOCATION WHEN
THE 5-DAY CUMULATIVE PROBABILITY IS AT LEAST 3 PERCENT.             
PROBABILITIES FOR 64 KT ARE SHOWN WHEN THE 5-DAY CUMULATIVE         
PROBABILITY IS AT LEAST 1 PERCENT.                                  
                                                                    
                                                                    
  - - - - WIND SPEED PROBABILITIES FOR SELECTED LOCATIONS - - - -   
                                                                    
               FROM    FROM    FROM    FROM    FROM    FROM    FROM 
  TIME       00Z WED 12Z WED 00Z THU 12Z THU 00Z FRI 00Z SAT 00Z SUN
PERIODS         TO      TO      TO      TO      TO      TO      TO  
             12Z WED 00Z THU 12Z THU 00Z FRI 00Z SAT 00Z SUN 00Z MON
                                                                    
FORECAST HOUR    (12)   (24)    (36)    (48)    (72)    (96)   (120)
- - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - 
LOCATION       KT                                                   
                                                                    
CAPE RACE NFLD 34  5   X( 5)   X( 5)   X( 5)   X( 5)   X( 5)   X( 5)
 
ILE ST PIERRE  34 11   X(11)   X(11)   X(11)   X(11)   X(11)   X(11)
 
$$                                                                  
FORECASTER CANGIALOSI
